This is a great house in a super location. Very quiet, nice big yard, lots of parking, easy to find, near the bike trails, near NMU, close to good restaurants.
The house was very, very clean; it was so nice.
Kasaim went above and beyond. A great welcome note with fresh, local muffins. He left non perishable food items; juice, pop, coffee and coffee maker and a fully stocked kitchen (pots/pans/dishes) for doing your own cooking, etc.
Kasaim communicated promptly and clearly.
I will definitely rent from Kasaim again. This is an excellent airbnb, and Kasaim is awesome.

I highly recommend staying here.

name: Sara
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
January 2024
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Kasaim’s house was perfect for our weekend in Marquette. We like to travel with our small dogs whenever possible but it’s always a challenge finding a place that’s private/not an apartment. Kasaim’s place was a gem as it was a full house with a lovely yard for them to play.
Kasaim offered many thoughtful amenities, including a box of pastries from a local bakery, a new sleeve of bagels with cream cheese and butter, orange juice, Coke and a frozen pizza to name some. He also provided a thorough guide book (on airbnb) of local recommendations for restaurants which we utilized the whole weekend.
There were plenty of towels and toiletries and an extra blanket for the bed. The shower got very hot and the water pressure was excellent.
Tv was well positioned for everyone and it was a smart Roku tv so you can sign into your streaming services.
Overall, I would rank Kasaim’s place higher than 5 stars if I could! Would definitely would stay again.
Thank you Kasaim!!!

name: Cyle
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
October 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Stayed for our wedding anniversary and my birthday.
Super cute little house.
Before we arrived we were messaged instructions to receive keys.
Once we were in the house, we noticed a little little snack from a local bakery. Super awesome touch. Host was very helpful. Even messaged us to make sure everything was going well.
Bathroom is very spacious and the towel folding is next level.
Kitchen was very clean and well organized. With everything we needed for our stay.
The living room had a cool coffee table, and reclining couch.
Smart TV has a few streaming services logged in which is always nice.
The bedrooms were a bit on the small side. But let's be realistic, you don't get a airbnb to sit in the bedroom.
Washer and dryer is a huge plus to get us cleaned and organized for our return trip.
If I were to change anything about this visit, it would be the beds themselves. Be aware they are very very firm. The firmness of the beds would be my only deterant from booking again.

name: William
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
September 2023
,
·
Stayed with a pet
review_text:
We drove up to a well-cared for place, on a quiet street, just three blocks from beach access. There is a new back porch and steps, leading into the kitchen. The living room has a nice arrangement for hanging out. Right away we noticed the bakery items Kasaim had left for us, along with a note essentially telling us to make ourselves at home. Kasaim had fire escape plans in the bedrooms, along with the address of this place and emergency number, should something catastrophic happen... it's been a while since we've seen experienced such a conscientious and generous host.
We highly recommend this place and will consider re-booking it, should we decide to vacation in Marquette. The town is bike friendly, with a trail running for miles along the lake. We liked being just three short blocks from a trail head. We have e-bikes and pull a BooYah, for our dog to ride in, so are seriously considering going back again some day.

name: Kathryn
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
September 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: We had a great 4-night stay in Kasaim’s place. This is what AirBnB is all about, in my opinion: the place is nothing *fancy* and it doesn’t have the same, carbon copied “AirBnB decor” that you see in 80% of listings. Instead, it’s cozy, functional, and thoughtfully and generously equipped by Kasaim (can you say fresh bakery muffins!?), plus we weren’t expected to do more than drop dirty linens in the hamper on our way out. We loved being able to ride right to the North trails, downtown, beaches, and Preque Isle. (The south trails were within riding distance too, but we chose to drive so we could have our car with provisions, beach stuff, etc.) We will definitely look to stay here again next time we’re in Marquette!

Well supplied bathroom. Even a couple beach towels if you forget yours. View on patio is gorgeous. Grill and table on patio. Even some backpack beach chairs. We were able to walk to all the restaurants we wanted to eat at. Great location for downtown shopping we walked to a lot of stores and even to the farmers market. My son and his girlfriend walked to several bars for the nightlife. If we make a return visit to Marquette this would definitely be my top choice to stay at. Loved it. Thanks for a wonderful visit!!

We had a wonderful experience at Anne’s place! Great location, right downtown Marquette and we loved being able to walk around everywhere around Marquette from coffee places to restaurants to breweries. Also had a great view of the harbor from our patio as we ate breakfast and sipped coffee. Excellent amenities, great layout from living room to kitchen to bedroom and very large bathroom and shower. We thoroughly enjoyed everything this place has to offer and we would definitely come back!
The only tricky part in Marquette is the parking with not much information even on the city website, but we figured it out that it was pay to park on the street from 9a-6p, and we were able to park on the street overnight for free.

review_text: This is an absolutely awesome place to stay. It is in downtown Marquette in a perfect location within walking distance to everything and a view of the water and ore dock from the deck. The condo itself is extremely well stocked, you could probably cook anything you could think of in the kitchen and have all the necessary kitchen wares and utensils. The towels and sheets were great quality and enough for our group of 4 adults and one baby. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were a good size. Having a washer and dryer was a huge convenience. We always bring our own detergents, but Anne had some in supply if we hadn't brought our own. The living room area was spacious and comfortable, but we spent most of our time out on the deck to enjoy the great view and wonderful weather. I can't say enough about how much we enjoyed our stay. If I could leave more than 5 stars in this review, I would!

We really enjoyed being able to walk everywhere!

If we could, we would give this place a 6.
We have been visiting Marquette at least twice a year for a very long time. The location of the unit provided a much better experience than we even expected.
Access to the outdoor space worked well for our small dog.
The place was immaculate! We have very high standards for cleanliness and this place exceeded our requirements.
The kitchen was fully equipped. Everything we needed for cooking and eating in was provided. The deck provided a convenient and attractive place to dine.
It was so wonderful to see the old buildings being repurposed.
We will return and recommend this to family members who also visit Marquette regularly.

Fantastic location within walking distance to everything you’d want to do in downtown Marquette. Very well-appointed in the kitchen with lovely furnishings and decoration.
Anne and Allyssa were excellent communicators and were very quick to help navigate the somewhat confusing parking situation. (Remember folks— you are staying in a rapidly growing downtown! Be a little forgiving on having to walk 1.5 blocks for free parking or paying less than $5/day for a meter right out front!)
One tip: if you need to use both bedrooms, bring a sleep mask. The lights on the public walkway right outside the second bedroom are very bright.

What a joy to be able to spend time in the old Trestle Building with a view of the Lower Ore Dock. A piece of history that has been given a new life. Be sure to check out the information boards across the street by the park to learn about this area.
Anne’s condo has everything you need - location, cleanliness, well equipped kitchen and bath. Bonus is TV with different popular streaming services. There are so many shops and restaurants within walking distance.
We had questions about the parking and how to work the TV system and Anne was quick to respond.
Be sure to include a drive out to Presque Isle in your itinerary with time to stop and enjoy the rugged coastal views.

review_text: Awesome place to spend in the Upper Peninsula. Cassie and Dave were fabulous hosts. They suggested many places to visit and eat and we took advantage and did so many. My favorites-swimming in Lake Superior (60 degrees), Macinac Island, Copper Harbor, hiking at Mosquito trails, glass bottom shipwreck tour, sunset cruise, Marquette town, 3 museums, and a mining tour. And we saw the Northern Lights one evening from the beach! Our stay was 8 days long and I look forward to coming back to this wonderful, serene place. On my bucket list is Isle Royale. We had 4 adults and the cottage was the perfect size. We enjoyed the fire pit almost every evening. Five star review.

I really cannot say enough to capture how beautiful this place is and how wonderful it was for our family. It is also located steps from a beautiful private beach, 6 minutes from the Lakenenland sculpture park, a 15-minute drive from downtown Marquette, and a short drive to lots of beautiful hiking spots, beaches, etc. We loved the location! Casandra was super communicative and responsive from before we ever started the trip, offering great suggestions for things to do with the kids while there, and she even reached out a few times during our stay to inform us of events happening in town. Thank you! We hope to return soon!

review_text:
The perfect private little getaway along the banks of Lake Superior! The cottage offered us complete isolation from the hustle and bustle of downtown Marquette. We were in town for the UP200, and when we found out the course runs across the street and the Midnight Run ended at the casino, we definitely got lucky on our location!
The cottage is beautifully decorated and cozy! It felt like a home away from home! Plenty of dishes and spices to cook in the kitchen. Bathroom was stocked and clean. We can't wait to stay again during another season!
Casandra was very communicative leading up to and during the stay. They helped clear the driveway and sidewalk of newly fallen snow, and she gave us the hints of where to best view the dog sled teams out on the courses!
We stayed as 4 adults, and no one minded the twin beds in the second room. The family room offered plenty of space to play games and socialize, while the kitchen had plenty of storage for snacks and drinks.
My favorite moment in the cottage was being able to make a fresh mug of coffee, read a book in the kitchen seating nook, and relax while fresh snow was fell outside.
If you want to truly relax in a tranquil environment, this is the stay for you!

name: Lara
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
July 2021
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
This might be our favorite Airbnb of all time. It was absolutely perfect for our family of 4. If we could give it more than 5 stars, we would. The cozy cabin is located just steps from a private, sandy Lake Superior beach that you access by walking through the hosts' backyard. The hosts are extremely available, super responsive, yet also very willing to give the guests privacy, so it doesn't feel like you're intruding by using the beach at all.
Highlights:
-The cabin was impeccably clean.
-It was VERY recently remodeled. Features include an absolutely gorgeous bathroom and kitchen, so much so that we were taking notes on the fixtures used for our own upcoming bathroom remodel.
-The beds were incredibly comfy, maybe the most comfortable we've ever experienced outside our own home.
-The Lake Superior beach is glorious. Perfect clean sand, gradual water depth, and just steps away. There's even a hose to use to spray off your feet before you walk back to the cabin!
-The location is amazing. Just 10 minutes from Marquette, and 30 minutes from Munising.
The only downside I can think of (and this is a stretch), is that the eat-in kitchen only has a table for 2 and there is no dishwasher. It's a small cabin, and the space they have is used VERY efficiently, but it's still small.
We hope to stay here again in the future, and will definitely be recommending it to our friends and family. Thank you so much for your hospitality, Casandra!

The bathroom was great, counter space and a nice shower. It felt great to have a nice place to shower after all the hiking we did. She also had so many nice touches, like several comfy blankets, a chocolate bar for us and comfy furniture. It's clear a lot of thought went into everything at this little cottage. I wished I could have stayed longer! There isn't a dishwasher or washer/dryer if that's important to you but we didn't need either so it was fine for us. It's a bit outside of town but an easy drive into town. Cassandra also drove by and gave us a few details and checked to see if we needed anything (from a good social distance) and was quick to respond to messages and checked in with us. Very much recommend this place!

The cabin is fully outfitted with everything you can think of - the small things like paper towel and a welcome gift and extra blankets and comfy towels and excellent dishes and sharp knives! (Seriously what is it with most AirBnBs and the crummy knives???). If you love good design and comfort and are looking for a place to enjoy being in as much as you enjoy being out and about, stay at the Superior Cottage!

review_text: Would stay at Casandra's again in a heartbeat! It's a beautiful, refreshingly well-designed space with lots of thoughtful touches. For context on our review and recommendation, we were longtime Marquette residents reuniting in our hometown for a holiday weekend. It was so lovely to stay outside of the "town proper" for a change of scenery. She and Dave are fantastic hosts, immensely warm and welcoming. Their location and property are great, with Lake Superior just up the driveway and around the front of the main house. It's a quick jaunt into town, with an equally easy drive to Au Train, Pictured Rocks, etc. Also love that you can pick up Iron Ore Heritage Trail nearby too, though I didn't take advantage this trip. Overall, highly recommend this spot for anyone visiting the area and looking cover a good amount of ground in various directions, while also enjoying beautiful lakefront life. It was a great homebase for us. Already starting to mull over when I can schedule another trip!

Flat and easy ride for us non-bikers.
Walking down to the lake is just a quick couple minutes. Water was high and reminded me of Duluth.
Casandra was very available and gave lots of good suggestions, yet she was totally respectful of our privacy. Highly recommend!

Cassie greeted us on our arrival, but gave us the choice of getting settled in first, always respectful of our privacy. We opted to have her meet us at the door, and we are glad she did, as she was full of good tips on where to explore Marquette hiking and restaurants/breweries.
On our way out we walked down the driveway to Lake Superior to experience the gales of November. It was amazing. Great location, great home, great hosts. We will be back!

We were pleasantly surprised by this apartment unit. It looks better than the pictures! It was very clean and expertly decorated with images and artwork from the city of Marquette. We comfortably slept two - one on the bed and one on the couch in the back room. The television in the main room had several streaming services, along with board games to fill in the open time between activities. Directions for the stay, as well as info about the apartment and surrounding areas made things rather easy for us.
Concerning location, the apartment is very close to downtown Marquette. We were able to walk down to the shops and restaurants and it was a relief not having to worry about a car.
It was an overall excellent experience! Wendy is a great host and was quick to answer any questions that came up. I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend this place to anyone looking for a good value and great location for lodgings in Marquette.

name: Iris

Rating, 5 stars

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Great little studio apartment that’s close to the Downtown Marquette area. Had the weather been a bit warmer, and the eateries / brewery able to seat customers (currently carry out only due to the state pandemic restrictions) the apartment would be a quick walk down the street.
There’s a main bedroom and a smaller sitting room area that looks like it could be an extra bed (by the bathroom.)
The main space includes a fridge, microwave, small stove, and pots, pans, glasses, dishware/utensils and even a few simple spices. There are also some games, which we did not use.
The owners are environmentally conscious and ask that people recycle, and they had big bins outside which made that easy to do.
Special touches include: the heated tile floor in the bathroom (!!!), a remote controlled lighted ceiling fan, a small “Alexa”, a white noise sound machine (which we didn’t need to use) and a smart TV including Sling, Netflix and Roku, etc. access as well as an outdoor deck area with a table, chairs and fire pit which they lit up for us.
The hosts, Wendy and David, were quick to respond to questions and friendly.
We hope to visit again!

review_text:
Stay #3 across as many years at Cole and Emily’s place, and it continues to be a truly relaxing experience. The house is comfortable, the view is amazing, the city is accommodating, and the hosts continue finding ways to make me feel more welcome and cherished as a visitor. They are super responsive, have concise and clear instructions, excellent recommendations, and are as friendly as you could hope for. The view of Lake Superior is both gorgeous and (when the wind is whipping) terrifying. The wood burning stove is a game changer - don’t wait for your third time to try it out like I did.
Overall, exactly what I wanted out of my stay, and I hope to be back a fourth time.

review_text:
With four kids and four businesses, my husband and I both needed our own version of time away to deflate, reflect and relax after a successful yet insane season. For him, it was a hunting trip. For me, Point of the Point, was my perfect version of absolute zen. The home is gorgeous, obviously loved and cared for, with views that make you praise God!
I went on several day hikes. Pictured Rocks, Presque Isle Park, Miner’s Falls that were all spectacular. I was so fortunate with the weather. I did however, stay in bed for 16 hours on one of my days. My body was grateful!
Emily and Cole were wonderful hosts and I can’t thank them enough for allowing me to melt away all the stress and worry at their peaceful, beautiful home.

review_text:
We had a fabulous getaway at Point of the Point! Even in early November, with some stormy weather, the view of the Lake and the surrounding areas was just incredible -- you can hear the waves hitting the shore from the bedrooms!
The house is an attraction all by itself. Such cool architecture, interesting design ideas, and the coziest wood burning stove that heats the whole house quickly. It was also the cleanest AirBNB we've ever stayed in -- and we've stayed in many.
We absolutely loved Marquette, and spent most days dividing our time between exploring the city and relaxing in the warm, cozy cabin. We highly recommend this as a U.P. destination, and hope to come back with our family in the future!

review_text: This cabin is the kind of place you find and immediately start dreaming of spending as much time there as you possibly can. Whether it was sitting on chairs at the lakes edge, taking a dip in the cool waters, or sitting inside and just gazing out the huge windows, being here brought us such peace and relaxation. We had planned to enjoy active days and dinner in Munising before returning to the cabin but each morning we found ourselves staying as long as we could before heading out to explore (for us it was mostly Pictured Rocks), then picking up groceries or take out and racing back to the cabin in time to enjoy as much daylight as possible before enjoying a comfortable and restful sleep. We honestly cannot wait to return, thank you for sharing your little slice of paradise with us!

Everything you could possibly need is available for use. The home is beautiful and unique. There are many interesting things to appreciate in the design including all of the exceptional touches, such as the chandelier, the stained glass, and inlaid doors. Of course, the best part is the view! The water is very clear, and the sunsets incredibly colorful. There is a perfect swimming hole, and a place for bon fires. We start looking forward to next year as soon as we pull out of the driveway!

I felt so much peace and happiness and spent lots of time lounging at the lake, enjoying brisk swims every day, as much as I did following their fantastic suggestions. Thank you for your fantastic hospitality in every way! I had so much fun sharing a meal with you, and I look forward to continuing my trips to the UP. There's no other place I'd rather be than at POTP!

It's probably because we are more city people, but unfortunately we could not enjoy the backyard due to mosquito swarms. Emily and Cole provided spray and a swatter. Even with that, we felt the need to run like fools from the car to the house. Maybe it's just bad in June and other months are less mosquito'd? Either way, warning to those who aren't used to the woods to be prepared for a lot of activity from flying parasites.

Point of the Point is beyond sublime. We had special guests from abroad, and this unique and well-maintained home was the perfect spot to have them experience the beauty and power of Lake Superior.
This house will have everything you need for a rustic yet plush stay; a well equipped kitchen, spacious living space, fire pit and swimming hole outside beyond the back porch and even an Apple TV.
Cole and Emily were also very responsive to our various questions and needs, and their friendliness elevated this experience which greatly surpassed our expectations. If you are in or around Marquette, PotP is the place for you.

We felt at home the minute we walked in and saw the aesthetic decor, stunning view, and the yummy bottle of wine and chocolate they had left for us. I had the best nights' sleep I've had in years and then enjoyed our morning coffee sitting on the rocks out front soaking in the view. The beds were comfy, the kitchen well-stocked, and the house manual had loads of really helpful information. Also loved reading the article about the construction of this house that's hanging on the wall. REALLY hope to stay here again someday. Thank you Emily and Cole!

review_text: Our family of 5 had a wonderful stay at Emily and Cole’s home. They were extremely responsive to messages leading up to our visit, and the trip itself was lovely. As many have said, the house is extremely clean. The shampoos and soaps smell wonderful, and the beds are comfortable. I would love to come back to this home with other adult friends, or when our kids are a little older. We do have a toddler, and because the home is so well-kept and lovely, I did have a lot of stress about her not making a mess of anything. It is definitely better suited to families whose children are able to navigate steps and sharp corners! Our older girls absolutely loved going out onto the rocks for sunset, and enjoying popsicles in the yard. Many wonderful memories in a corner of the world we have never been before!!

I really enjoyed lounging like a seal on the rocks on their shore. The place is conveniently located to Marquette and Munising, and there are tons of activities to enjoy locally. If you are considering renting this property, do it! Reserve now because the schedule fills up quickly.

Emily and Cole are great hosts and communication is quick and responsive.
One of our favorite places to stay in the summer.
House is always clean and you honestly won’t find a more beautiful peaceful spot to stay.

The home itself is a work of art, totally unique and with views unable to be appreciated without occupying the space. Very nice neighbors on a secluded street, it was a quiet and peaceful vacation for our family. The warmth of this place is truly magical and we would each recommend this stay to anyone even slightly interested. Cole and Emily were perfect hosts, easy to get a hold of and extremely accommodating. We plan to return in the future and would encourage the same to anyone

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: My husband and I came to the UP to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary. Cole and Emily had a perfect spot for our stay. The house has unique architecture, but it is also comfortable and inviting.Cole and Emily keep their house very clean, which was super important to me. To me, the main magic was the view from the front window in the morning and the cozy fire in the wood stove at night. We love and know the UP pretty well, so cross country skiing and hiking to ice caves was a great delight for us. We highly recommend this place, if you will be lucky to find an open date :)

name: Tina
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
February 2022
,
·
Group trip
review_text: All I can say is this couple knows how to do an Airbnb! First off, it was immaculate! Cleanest place I’ve been to. They also thought of everything you could possibly need, like fans, games, soap/shampoo and the list goes on! I also appreciated that the place wasn’t cluttered. I hate when every table, bookcase, cabinet is stuffed or full of things. This allowed us to settle our own things in, have room to plug in cell phones and put our needed items away. I loved that everything was well maintained and in good working order. They definitely give this home the attention it needs to keep it running smoothly. To help those determining if this place would work for activities with any kind of gear, don’t worry! There is a big sitting/mud room as soon as you enter the house. We did some hiking and ice climbing, and storing our gear was no problem. We appreciate this sweet couple for sharing such a special place with all of us. The views in every direction were breathtaking! Communication was also spot on! Thanks again Cole and Emily! We WILL be back!

Beautiful, unique place with a awesome view of Lake Superior. Scenery from the main windows was constantly changing and always spectacular. We did leave the place to check out local attractions, but always enjoyed coming back to the cabin.
We stayed during one of the colder weeks of the year but their wood burning stove was fun and kept the place toasty.
House was cozy and comfortable for our group of four. Enjoyed full kitchen, comfortable beds, and other amenities. We would definitely stay here again.
Hosts Emily and Cole are welcoming, accommodating, and easy to communicate with.

If you can score a trip here, do it and do it now. We all agreed this was the absolute best Airbnb experience we’ve ever had. The property is so unique in and of itself, but staying here actually made us amend all of our plans because we genuinely wanted more time at the cabin. The wood stove is such an amazing amenity in the winter.
As an added bonus, the beds are insanely comfortable, the house is SO clean, and the bits of history of the home really make it even better. Plus Emily was stellar to communicate with. We really needed this vacation and staying here was honestly the best part. Thank you so much Cole and Emily, we loved it here more than we can say.

Point Of the Point always wins our hearts over. The amazing view of Lake Superior, the cozy warm fireplace, the beautiful trees/leaves, and the many trails and bike paths nearby, make our trips to Marquette something to look forward to.
Emily and Cole's place is always extremely clean, easily accessible, and always well stocked with linens, kitchen utensils, paper goods, etc. Their place is simply beautiful with lake superior being the main attraction.
Communication and instructions are always clear.
We will be back. Point of the Point is a Marquette gem!

If you love peace and quiet, nature's beauty, the sound of the lake waves, gorgeous sunsets, amazing stars and the Milky Way then this home is perfect. Emily and Cole were delightful and attentive. The house was clean, well furnished and we loved waking up there and having coffee on the deck. The huge windows overlooking the lake are awesome. We sat in our camp chairs on the rocks by the lake in the evening and star gazed.
It was a perfect distance between lovely Marquette and the Pictured Rocks. It was also fun to bike the short distance to Lakenenland Sculpture Park and view the fun sculptures.
Highly recommend Point on the Point. Thanks Emily and Cole!

On the last day of our visit last year, I booked this year's vacation. On the first day of this year's vacation, I booked next year's vacation.
We are so drawn to Emily and Cole's home, and feel right at home in their incomparable location.
It's the perfect spot if you're hoping to sequester from the busy-ness of life and incredible convenient if you're looking to explore downtown Marquette, Pictured Rocks, Canyon Falls, and anything else that is wild and beautiful in the area.
We are so grateful to have spotted their gorgeous home, and anticipate that it will remain a mainstay when it comes to wanting a getaway.
Thank you again, Emily and Cole!

review_text:
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this beautiful spot. The warmth of the house itself and the outstanding location and views (esp sunsets) are absolute highlights. Emily and Cole were kind and friendly and communicated quickly and clearly. Wonderful hosts and a wonderful home.
We had several warm days but were able to keep things cool inside with fans to direct the breeze. Wifi was helpful to keep me connected to work when needed. The kitchen was easy to navigate and supplied with appliances to prepare our own meals, but Marquette is a very short drive away for dinners out. The location works well as a home base for day trips or as a comfortable refuge to get away from touristy crowds. We would certainly be happy to return!

review_text: What an amazing place to spend a week! This was our 2nd stay at this beautiful home and it was even better than the 1st. We enjoyed a family of loons, saw a bald eagle carrying a fish, and all of the flowers that grow around the property. The water is so clear and great for swimming. The house is well stocked with everything you could possibly need. Cole and Emily are fabulous and always quick to respond I can't say enough about this place. I highly recommend it! We will be back next year for our 3rd year in a row. Can't wait!

review_text: These pictures do not do this house justice. It was so spacious, with amazing views of Lake Superior. The hosts were so clear with instructions to everything in the home, and had every thing you could imagine needing during your stay, even a lint brush and small sewing kit! The walk was super short over some rocks to Lake Superior and it was so peaceful and quiet, without any of the recreational water toys you see in other areas. Located perfectly between Munising and Marquette, there was plenty to see if you could bring yourself to leave such a beautiful home. We enjoyed it so much, we are planning a return trip next year!

rating_info:

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Highly recommend this Airbnb. Great location to downtown Marquette, right across from a coffee shop and top notch wine store. Quiet location, really didn't notice the store downstairs or the other upstairs apartment. Roomy enough for the two of us, tastefully decorated, basics of what you need in a kitchen are provided if you want to cook. Provided paper towel and dish washing supplies, would need to bring your own storage stuff like variety of storage bags or containers, also things like tinfoil or saranwrap. Plenty of good places to eat in Marquette though if you don't plan to cook! Shower was really nice, great lighting in the bathroom by the mirror, very appreciated. Bed was comfortable as was living room furniture. No closet in the bedroom, but an overdoor hook thing they had did the trick. If you have a lot to hang, bring hangers to maximize the space. Hosts are very responsive to questions, very friendly. We hope to come back someday!

The kitchen was really clean and they had pans/pots/spices that unfortunately we only used twice since there was so many good restaurants around lol. The mud room was a good inbetween, we went hiking a few times and it was super convenient to be able to take off our shoes/coats in there. The space was very clear and tidy and easy to navigate. The offroad parking space was also super convenient since we were right at the foot of the staircase and able to bring our bags up super easily.
Thanks again!

The only driving we had to do was to go for the trail we wanted to hike north of the city. It was efficient and clean. We enjoyed having coffee and watching the sunrise in the heated entrance area. It was nice to have a free parking spot, as everywhere around us was pay to park. Luckily, there was not a lot of snow or ice which could have made the steps up a bit difficult. It was more quiet than I thought it would be except for the first night when the city workers were scraping and hauling snow from the street at 3:30 a.m., but that was out of the hands of the host. I would recommend this place for a couple looking for a get away.

It did feel a bit expensive for the small amount of space, but everything in the area is priced relatively the same. Not to mention, the location is priceless. Highly recommend Ore Dock Brewery and Black River Coffee, we went to each every single day! It was truly a great stay, highly recommend. We hope to be back next year!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Unfortunately, because of flight delays, I was not actually able to be part of the reservation in person. I was apprehensive that it would be difficult for the two other guests whom I was supposed to meet there to check in and get all of the necessary information, since the reservation had been made under my account, but it turned out not to be an issue. Debora provided clear and comprehensive written instructions that I was simply able to screenshot and pass along to the other guests, and they seemed to have no trouble with any of the details.
They noted that the available parking was nearby and easy to find and that the apartment itself was comfortable, interesting, and had a homey feeling. They praised the color scheme and the quality of the furnishings. The ambient temperature , water pressure, natural lighting, and view of the lake were all great. Although it stormed during the stay, they found it pleasant to watch over the lake. The only complaint was that I wasn't also there!

Stayed a few nights
review_text: This is our 2nd time staying here, and we already can't wait to come back. The mid-century aesthetic is top-notch. The apartment has plenty of space and is very clean. There are coffee shops (Dead River and MQT Provisions are super close and good) , restaurants, breweries, and shops galore all within walking distance. If you like live music ( or just good beer and good company) check out Ore Dock Brewing co. Check their FB page to see if they have a band while you're there! The Vierling and Iron Bay Restaurant were also great. We rented bikes from MQT Bike Rental to bike the multi-use path. I said this two years ago, and I will say again that this is my favorite vacation rental ( of many) that we have stayed at.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Consistent with the other reviews, this place was great! The location was perfect and Deb was a friendly, gracious, and responsive host. The mid-century vibe is pretty awesome - no detail has been spared in furnishings, fixtures or decor. We weren't inside much because we spent most of our time exploring Marquette and surroundings, but I can imagine it being a comfortable and fun place to hang out during inclement weather. Lots of old-school board games and records to enjoy. We enjoyed being steps away from the lake, a short walking distance from downtown and the marina, and minutes from some of the better food and beer options in Marquette. This was our first visit to Marquette, but we'll definitely be back and I'd absolutely stay here again if availability allows.

Loved the layout (spacious and easy to be working in the kitchen and still see everyone/everything), location, and overall stay!

Rating, 4 stars

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
We really enjoyed our stay and loved the space but could easily be fixed for a more pleasurable experience with a pretty low investment.
Pros: the space is much larger than it looks in pictures, location is fantastic, Debs communication was clear, quick, and concise, enough linens to last a year, sound system
Cons: the shower curtain needs replaced as it is covered in mildew, the bathroom is not level(jokes that it was the 2nd mystery spot), the kitchen is literally only stocked with salt and pepper(no sugar, flour, or seasonings of any kind), no TVs in either bedroom, king mattress is on a box spring on the floor, a ton of records(looks like mostly freebies from goodwill).
Overall: this space is ideal and perfect for a single night or two stay. With a pretty low investment it would greatly improve the overall experience guests may have. I would stay again, but only on a quick trip.

We will definitely be staying here again for our next trip to MQT!

Stayed a few nights
review_text: You can’t go wrong with this unique and utterly charming apartment overlooking Lake Superior in downtown Marquette, just steps away from local coffee shops, microbreweries, fantastic restaurants, shops and even a local fisherman selling fresh-caught Whitefish from a Quonset hut. Watch a few episodes of Mad Men to get in the mood and prepare yourself for a step back in time, both in the apartment and with in the small town charm of Marquette. Relax with a beer from Ore Dock after a meal at Iron Bay — both just a short jaunt away. Just know it’s on a busy street, but everyone driving by is missing out on the experience you get to have in this beguiling spot.

I had trouble holding a streaming service on the TV - I assume it was a Wi-Fi strength issue - but I was able to connect my devices without a problem. It's also located on a pretty busy street so if you're a light sleeper, you could find it noisy. However, it didn't bother me. I thought it was a great value. She doesn't charge what she probably could based upon other rentals in the area.

It is fine, just not one I was used to so glad she explains it in the check in instructions. She is a great host, flexible and good communicator. Hope to stay again in the future.
